alert.note: Alert for Charlotte (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 1:01AM EDT until August 31 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, and southwest Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Hardee. In south central Florida, DeSoto. In southwest Florida, Charlotte and Lee. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 101 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Punta Gorda, Arcadia, Charlotte County Airport, Babcock Webb Wma, Palmona Park, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, Babcock Ranch, East Dunbar, Matlacha Isles- Matlacha Shores, Matlacha, Pineland, Pine Island Center, Pine Manor, McGregor, Villas, Cypress Lake, St. James City and Iona. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
